intro: Hypecoum erectum, commonly known as the upright hogweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has large, heart-shaped leaves that are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. Hypecoum erectum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream sides.
